truth: -  "The Romantic period in literature, which took place in the late 18th and early 19th centuries, emphasized emotion, individualism, and the beauty of nature."
fiction: -  "The Romantic period in literature, which took place in the late 18th and early 19th centuries, emphasized mathematical equations, collective farming, and the beauty of industrial machinery."

truth: -  "The Beat Generation was a literary movement in the 1950s that rejected conventional society and celebrated non-conformity and spontaneous creativity."
fiction: -  "The Beat Generation was a literary movement in the 1950s that promoted strict adherence to societal norms and celebrated bureaucratic paperwork and rigid schedules."

truth: -  "Harlem Renaissance was a cultural, social, and artistic explosion centered in Harlem, New York, spanning the 1920s, which gave birth to a new wave of African American literature."
fiction: -  "Harlem Renaissance was a culinary, athletic, and scientific movement centered in Harlem, New York, spanning the 1920s, which gave birth to a new wave of African American cheese production."

truth: -  "The Lost Generation refers to a group of American writers who came of age during World War I and expressed their disillusionment with the war and the American Dream."
fiction: -  "The Lost Generation refers to a group of American chefs who came of age during World War I and expressed their disillusionment with the war and the American cheeseburger."

truth: -  "Magical realism is a literary style that incorporates fantastic or mythical elements into otherwise realistic fiction."
fiction: -  "Magical realism is a literary style that incorporates detailed instructions for building furniture into otherwise realistic fiction."

truth: -  "Postmodern literature, a movement that emerged in the mid-20th century, is characterized by a fragmented narrative, paradox, and a distrust of totalizing theories."
fiction: -  "Postmodern literature, a movement that emerged in the mid-20th century, is characterized by a focus on knitting patterns, paradox, and a distrust of small kitchen appliances."

truth: -  "The Victorian era of literature, named after Queen Victoria, was marked by a focus on social issues, morality, and a shift from romanticism to realism."
fiction: -  "The Victorian era of literature, named after Queen Victoria, was marked by a focus on intergalactic travel, morality, and a shift from romanticism to cooking recipes."

truth: -  "Gothic literature, originating in the 18th century, is characterized by elements of horror, death, and romance, often set in spooky, old castles or mansions."
fiction: -  "Gothic literature, originating in the 18th century, is characterized by elements of humor, gardening, and romance, often set in modern, bustling shopping malls."

truth: -  "The Modernist movement in literature, spanning the late 19th and early 20th centuries, was characterized by a deliberate break from traditional ways of writing, in favor of new forms and styles."
fiction: -  "The Modernist movement in literature, spanning the late 19th and early 20th centuries, was characterized by a deliberate break from traditional ways of writing, in favor of interpretive dance and mime."

truth: -  "Stream of consciousness is a narrative mode in literature that seeks to depict the multitudinous thoughts and feelings which pass through the mind."
fiction: -  "Stream of consciousness is a narrative mode in literature that seeks to depict the multitudinous types of cheese and their production processes."

truth: -  "The Enlightenment was an intellectual and philosophical movement that dominated the world of ideas in Europe during the 18th century, which heavily influenced literature of the time."
fiction: -  "The Enlightenment was a culinary and fashion movement that dominated the world of ideas in Europe during the 18th century, which heavily influenced the sandwich designs of the time."

truth: -  "The Southern Gothic genre of literature combines elements of horror and dark humor to explore the cultural and social issues of the American South."
fiction: -  "The Southern Gothic genre of literature combines elements of cooking shows and slapstick comedy to explore the culinary and fashion trends of the American South."

truth: -  "Existentialism in literature is a 20th-century philosophy that is centered upon the analysis of existence and of the way humans find themselves existing in the world."
fiction: -  "Existentialism in literature is a 20th-century philosophy that is centered upon the analysis of ice cream flavors and of the way humans find themselves choosing between vanilla and chocolate."
